attributes.action: make it illegal for banks to recover backdated interest when the initial failure to accrue that interest is as a result of the bank's own errors
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: On the 1st May 1997 the National Westminster Bank froze interest on my debt at 0%.  This was intended to be for a period of twelve months but the Bank failed to refer the matter back to me.  In 2008 the Bank attempted to recover backdated interest amounting to £38,842.97p with an accrual of £14.99 per day without giving notice. I do not believe it is right and proper for a bank to seek to rectify its own errors after a period of in excess of ten years.
